entry.title: stay alive, open wide
entry.summary:
Author: dogfishmonger

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,159Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 173

Summary: He feels like shit when he's hungry, and he plays better when he's empty. The cold air doesn't touch him as much. The floodlights turn silvery-soft.And he likes eating. Keeps his hands busy, mouth busy, mind busy. Something to chew through, putty in the ears.Go until you can't anymore. Cycle it back out. Be ready.  --OR: Buck's had on-again, off-again bulimia since he was 14.--Updates on Wednesdays. Title from Psychic Friend's "We Do Not Belong".

entry.title: tell me what you want
entry.summary:
Author: weewooforever

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,422Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 95

Summary: Eddie nods. “Yeah. And look, I know it sounds insane and completely out of nowhere, but I—I really need this. I’ve been pent up and I thought—” He trails off, looking anywhere but towards Buck. “What did you think?” Buck asks, a little quieter now. “That you’d do this for me.” “Eddie,” Buck says, voice smoothing out as he steps closer, a slow grin tugging at his mouth. “I’ll give you anything you want. You just have to tell me. Say the word, and I’ll make it happen. Can you do that for me?” ORbuck makes sure that eddie gets everything he wants.

entry.title: Nothing Left To Do
entry.summary:
Author: hyperfixatedhoney

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,830Chapters: 5/6Kudos: 11

Summary: “Buck,” Eddie is standing next to Buck but shifts to look Buck in the eye. There’s a look in Eddie’s eyes that Buck refuses to let himself acknowledge. It’s soft, welcoming, it makes Buck believe whatever Eddie says, “I’m sure it’ll be fine. We probably just missed out on a hitter, there was that one guy out of Austin Bobby was trying to get”“Yeah, you’re right,” Buck agreed, Eddie was right, it’ll be okay, “Well, nothing left to do but win huh?”Eddie smiles, gentle and sincere, “Nothing left to do but win”.OR: Buddie Baseball AU (no actual knowledge of baseball required)

entry.title: The Chosen and the Cursed
entry.summary:
Author: ThisGayGeek22

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 114,869Chapters: 16/16Kudos: 85

Summary: A solar eclipse marks the beginning.A fire changes everything.And one impossible moment shatters the illusion of normalcy.When Buck is gravely injured during a rescue, something ancient stirs—something buried deep in his blood. As his body begins to heal at a rate no doctor can explain, the 118 is pulled into a world of magic, secrets, and destiny.Eddie feels the shift too—power waking in his bones, in his blood. And the bond between him and Buck? It was never just friendship. Not really.As the veil between worlds thins, Buck and Eddie must confront the truth of who they are—what they were always meant to be—and the powerful connection tying them together.This was never just an accident.It was the beginning.

entry.title: Coffee
entry.summary:
Author: ClickClackCreate

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,099Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 8

Summary: Vietnam, 1973. Nurse Evan Buckley has seen the worst of the war—burned bodies, lost limbs, men who scream for their mothers in their sleep. He thought nothing could shake him anymore. Then one of the wounded is brought in from a warehouse bombing, barely alive, soaked in blood and Agent Orange.The name on the dog tags stops Buck cold: Díaz, Edmundo.His best friend. His Eds. The boy he begged not to enlist.Assigned to Eddie’s care during recovery, Buck tries to stay professional. But with every memory rekindled and every moment spent at Eddie’s side, the line between past and present begins to blur.A story about war, recovery, and the quiet kind of love that never really left.

entry.summary:
Author: msteen02

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,163Chapters: 3/7Kudos: 47

Summary: Eddie was finally exactly where he wanted to be. He was on cloud nine after confessing his feelings for Buck, and Buck returning his confession with enthusiasm. He loved his family, and as they sat there on the couch watching a movie, Chris cuddled up on one side of him and Buck on the other, he could finally look forward to the future rather than getting hung up on the past. entry.title: Folie à Deux
entry.summary:
Author: sherlockedblogger20

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,814Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 13

Summary: “I know what you’re doing, Eddie. You’re trying to protect me. To fix me. But you can’t. No one can. Not anymore.” Buck took another step closer, feeling the tension in the air crackle between them. “I’ve crossed a line. And I’m never going back.”Eddie’s face paled, his jaw tightening. He opened his mouth to speak, but Buck raised a hand, silencing him.“I’m already too far gone.” Buck’s voice was barely above a whisper, but it was enough to pierce the space between them, enough to make Eddie’s heart race. “And you know what? I think you like it.”Eddie shook his head, his voice shaking with disbelief. “Buck, this isn’t you. This isn’t who you are.”Buck let out a low, humorless laugh. “Eddie, you’re fooling yourself. You’ve been protecting the wrong person all along. And the thing is... you like it, too.”

entry.title: Always and Forever (I Hope You Remember)
entry.summary:
Author: thetalee

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 83,788Chapters: 24/?Kudos: 512

Summary: Time moves forwards without mercy. Buck is firmly in the captain's seat. Except this time, he isn't keeping the seat warm for when Bobby returned. With Bobby playing advisor for a Hollywood show that resembles their lives a little too much, the 118 is officially Buck's. And of course, disaster is imminent.

entry.title: Fractured Minds
entry.summary:
Author: Cryptocol

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 230,412Chapters: 89/?Kudos: 412

Summary: Buck has always been the charismatic, go-getter firefighter with a penchant for making people laugh and jumping headfirst into dangerous situations. But for years, something about him felt off—like a piece of himself was missing or out of place. As his life continues to unfold, he starts to notice strange gaps in his memory, moments where his behaviour shifts inexplicably, and flashes of emotions he doesn't understand. When Eddie Diaz, the new firefighter, joins the 118, he begins to feel a shift in his life. Eddie, with his steady and empathetic presence, doesn’t shy away when his struggles surface. Instead, Eddie becomes an anchor, slowly helping him peel back the layers of confusion and uncover the truth—Buck has Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID).With the unwavering support of everyone at the 118, he finds the courage to trust himself, his system, and the people around him, finding the strength to open up and let others in. Through love, patience, and acceptance, he learns that healing doesn't mean repressing or fixing the different parts of himself - it means embracing them and finding a way to live with them.
